config.question: In the First Continental Congress, Samuel Adams engineered congressional acceptance of what statement encouraging forcible resistance to the Coercive Acts?

answer_3.response: Consider This: This congressional decision established the tone of the meeting. It shifted away from the conciliatory position of the moderates to the confrontational stand of the radicals. See L.O. 5.3 What events in 1775 and 1776 led to the colonists’ decision to declare independence?
